text: Pour the lentils in a colander. Set it in the kitchen sink and run cold water over them to clean them. Rinse them until you are sure that they are clean. Set it aside to drain. Melt 2 tablespoons butter or margarine in a large saucepan.  Add onion and sauté until tender.  Add water, drained lentils, rice, turmeric, salt and pepper and meatballs.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and cover. Simmer over low heat 40 minutes or until lentils and rice are tender. Open the pomegranate and extract the juice using a lemon squeezer. Or, separate the seeds (as shown in the video below) and use the method described in How to Make Pomegranate Juice. Add the pomegranate juice along with parsley and green onions and simmer about 15 minutes longer.  Melt 1 tablespoon butter or margarine in a small skillet.  Add mint and raisins. sauté until butter or margarine is golden brown. Pour over soup. Finished.
